children.text: The box gutter in this area has not been provided with sufficient fall, and water has been ponding, creating a weak point in the gutter design that is susceptible to leaking.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Box Gutter Design Fact Sheet states that
‘Box gutter gradients shall not be flatter than 1:200 for sole widths equal to or less than 600mm wide. Deviations from the gradient must be smooth and prevent permanent ponding’ .
This box gutter must be properly rectified to ensure minimum falls and proper water discharge in accordance with Australian Standard AS 3500 – Plumbing and Drainage.
